alert.note: Alert for Morton; Stanton; Stevens (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 05 at 4:35AM CDT until April 06 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions The Next Few Days... .Dry conditions and gusty west to northwest winds will create critical fire weather conditions over far southwest Kansas this afternoon. Wednesday and Thursday will see very strong northwest winds developing. This along with humidity levels falling to around 10-15 percent will create very critical fire weather conditions both days. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 074...084 AND 085... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 074...084 AND 085... The National Weather Service in Dodge City has issued a Red Flag Warning FOR strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon to 8 PM CDT Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Kansas...Fire Weather Zone 074 Stanton... Fire Weather Zone 084 Morton and Fire Weather Zone 085 Stevens. * Winds...Northwest winds increasing to 15 to 25 mph this afternoon. North 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph on Wednesday. * Relative Humidity...As low as 9 percent. * Temperatures...In the lower 80s this afternoon. In the upper 50s on Wednesday afternoon. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
